018package org.opengis.filter;
019
020import java.util.Optional;
021import org.opengis.util.ControlledVocabulary;
022import org.opengis.annotation.UML;
023
024import static org.opengis.annotation.Obligation.CONDITIONAL;
025import static org.opengis.annotation.Specification.ISO_19143;
026
027
028/**
029 * Captures the {@link SortBy} order, ascending or descending.
030 *
031 * @author  Jody Garnett (Refractions Research)
032 * @author  Martin Desruisseaux (Geomatys)
033 * @version 3.1
034 * @since   3.1
035 */
036@UML(identifier="SortOrder", specification=ISO_19143)
037public enum SortOrder implements ControlledVocabulary {
038    /**
039     * Indicates that an ascending sort, in the collation sequence of the underlying data store, is performed.
040     * This is the {@link SortProperty} default value.
041     */
042    @UML(identifier="ascending", obligation=CONDITIONAL, specification=ISO_19143)
043    ASCENDING("ascending", "ASC"),
044
045    /**
046     * Indicates that a descending sort, in the collation sequence of the filter expression processor, is performed.
047     */
048    @UML(identifier="descending", obligation=CONDITIONAL, specification=ISO_19143)
049    DESCENDING("descending", "DESC");
050
051    /**
052     * The UML identifier.
053     */
054    private final String identifier;
055
056    /**
057     * The name used in SQL statements.
058     */
059    private final String sql;
060
061    /**
062     * Creates a new constant with the given UML identifier.
063     *
064     * @param identifier  the UML identifier.
065     * @param sql  name used in SQL statements.
066     */
067    private SortOrder(final String identifier, final String sql) {
068        this.identifier = identifier;
069        this.sql = sql;
070    }
071
072    /**
073     * Returns the UML identifier for this enumeration constant.
074     */
075    @Override
076    public Optional<String> identifier() {
077        return Optional.ofNullable(identifier);
078    }
079
080    /**
081     * Returns the name used in SQL statements.
082     * This is {@code "ASC"} or {@code "DESC"}.
083     *
084     * @return name used in SQL statements.
085     */
086    public String toSQL() {
087        return sql;
088    }
089
090    /**
091     * Returns the programmatic name of this constant together with its identifier and SQL name.
092     */
093    @Override
094    public String[] names() {
095        return new String[] {name(), identifier, sql};
096    }
097
098    /**
099     * Returns all constants defined by this enumeration type.
100     * Invoking this method is equivalent to invoking {@link #values()}, except that this
101     * method can be invoked on an instance of the {@code ControlledVocabulary} interface
102     * (i.e. the enumeration type does not need to be known at compile-time).
103     *
104     * @return all {@linkplain #values() values} for this enumeration.
105     */
106    @Override
107    public SortOrder[] family() {
108        return values();
109    }
110}
